Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips scored 104 runs off 64 deliveries, the top score in the match, to help New Zealand to a 65-run win over Sri Lanka.
Trent Boult took four wickets, contributing significantly to New Zealand's victory.
New Zealand were three down inside the Powerplay after Finn Allen, Devon Conway, and Kane Williamson were all dismissed cheaply.
Glenn Phillips and Daryl Mitchell put together an 84-run partnership in the next 10.5 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Glenn Phillips expressed that this century was the most special innings of his short-form career so far, especially because it was on a World Cup stage.
Phillips emphasized the overall team effort and the satisfaction of winning in a sticky situation.
Phillips commented on the importance of running between the wickets and the intent to show presence, especially with Sri Lanka on top at that stage.
Phillips praised his batting partner Daryl Mitchell for his belief and ability to handle tough situations.
Phillips mentioned his intention to entertain fans and enjoy the game as much as possible.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Phillips' century was notable for the high number of runs (40) made by running between the wickets, which is unusual in T20 format.
Phillips' previous T20I century against West Indies in 2020 had only 20 runs from non-boundary runs.
The long boundaries, slow outfields, and tricky surface contributed to the unusual nature of Phillips' innings.
Phillips' commentary and humorous remarks during his innings were picked up on the stump mic, adding to the entertainment.
